logTitle: IELTS Reading Log: The future of work

lexicalItems.sourceContext: 3–14% of the global workforce will need to switch to a different occupation within the next 10–15 years...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The total number of people who are employed or available for work across the world
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Lực lượng lao động toàn cầu

phase3Production.content: The pandemic has had a significant impact on the global workforce.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the global workforce will need to switch to a different occupation within the next 10–15 years...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To change one's job or profession to another one
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chuyển sang một nghề nghiệp khác

phase3Production.content: After ten years in marketing, she decided to switch to a different occupation and become a teacher.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Automation – or ‘embodied artificial intelligence’ (AI) – is one aspect of the disruptive effects of technology on the labour market.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'ảnh hưởng' (effects) 'gây đột phá/gây gián đoạn' (disruptive)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Influences that radically change an industry or business strategy
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những ảnh hưởng đột phá/gây gián đoạn

phase3Production.content: The rise of streaming services had disruptive effects on the traditional television industry.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Dr Stella Pachidi... believes that some of the most fundamental changes are happening as a result of the ‘algorithmication’ of jobs...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Very basic and important changes that affect the core nature of something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những thay đổi cơ bản/nền tảng

phase3Production.content: The internet has brought about fundamental changes to the way we communicate.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the so-called knowledge economy.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An economy in which growth is dependent on the quantity, quality, and accessibility of the information available, rather than on the means of production
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nền kinh tế tri thức

phase3Production.content: In a knowledge economy, education and innovation are crucial for success.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Algorithms are capable of learning from data to undertake tasks that previously needed human judgement...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To take responsibility for and begin to do a piece of work
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đảm nhận các nhiệm vụ

phase3Production.content: The new intern is willing to undertake any tasks assigned to her.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...tasks that previously needed human judgement, such as reading legal contracts...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The ability to make considered decisions or come to sensible conclusions, based on human experience and intuition
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự phán đoán của con người

phase3Production.content: Even the most advanced AI lacks the nuanced human judgement needed for some decisions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...analysing medical scans and gathering market intelligence.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process of collecting and analysing information about a company's market, competitors, and customers
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thu thập thông tin tình báo thị trường

phase3Production.content: Gathering market intelligence is a crucial first step before launching a new product.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘In many cases, they can outperform humans,’ says Pachidi.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To perform better or be more successful than people
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Vượt trội hơn con người

phase3Production.content: In tasks involving rapid calculation, computers can easily outperform humans.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...as well as to reduce costs and enhance productivity.’

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To improve or increase the rate at which goods are produced or work is completed
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nâng cao năng suất

phase3Production.content: The company introduced new software to help enhance productivity.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘But these enhancements are not without consequences,’ says Pachidi.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Không phải là không có' (not without) 'hậu quả' (consequences)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An expression meaning that something does have consequences, often negative ones
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Không phải là không có hậu quả

phase3Production.content: The rapid development of the city was not without consequences for the environment.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘If routine cognitive tasks are taken over by AI, how do professions develop their future experts?’

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Standard, everyday mental tasks that require thought
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các nhiệm vụ nhận thức thông thường

phase3Production.content: Automation is most effective at handling routine cognitive tasks.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: a novice stands next to experts
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘One way of learning about a job is “legitimate peripheral participation” – a novice stands next to experts and learns by observation.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'người mới vào nghề' (novice) 'đứng cạnh' (stands next to) 'các chuyên gia' (experts)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A beginner positions themselves beside experienced professionals to learn
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một người mới vào nghề đứng cạnh các chuyên gia

phase3Production.content: In traditional apprenticeships, a novice stands next to experts for years to master a craft.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Another issue is the extent to which the technology influences or even controls the workforce.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have power over the employees and direct their work
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Kiểm soát lực lượng lao động

phase3Production.content: The new management system increasingly controls the workforce through data monitoring.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...using the benefit of experience to assess a situation and reach a decision.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To judge or evaluate the nature or quality of a particular set of circumstances
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đánh giá một tình huống

phase3Production.content: A good leader must be able to quickly assess a situation and make a decision.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...Pachidi believes, a short-sighted view begins to creep in...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An outlook that does not consider the long-term consequences of an action
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một cái nhìn thiển cận

phase3Production.content: Focusing only on immediate profits is a short-sighted view that can harm the company in the long run.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and become dependent on its instructions.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To come to rely on someone or something and be unable to manage without them
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trở nên phụ thuộc vào

phase3Production.content: It is easy to become dependent on your smartphone for directions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...where experimentation and human instinct lead to progress and new ideas – are effectively discouraged.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The natural tendency that a person has to behave or react in a particular way, without thinking or learning
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bản năng con người

phase3Production.content: Sometimes, you just have to trust your human instinct when making a difficult choice.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...are effectively discouraged.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bị 'ngăn cản/làm nản lòng' (discouraged) 'một cách hiệu quả' (effectively)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be prevented from doing something in a way that produces the intended result
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bị cản trở một cách hiệu quả

phase3Production.content: The high taxes have effectively discouraged new investment in the area.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...developing strategies to make the algorithm work to their own advantage.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Hoạt động 'theo hướng có lợi cho chính họ' (to their own advantage)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To function in a way that benefits oneself
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hoạt động theo hướng có lợi cho chính họ

phase3Production.content: She managed to turn the situation to her own advantage.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: feed the algorithm with false data
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘We are seeing cases where workers feed the algorithm with false data to reach their targets,’ she reports.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Cung cấp' (feed) 'cho thuật toán' (the algorithm) 'dữ liệu' (data) 'sai lệch' (false)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To provide an algorithm with incorrect or misleading information
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cung cấp cho thuật toán dữ liệu sai lệch

phase3Production.content: Some users try to feed the algorithm with false data to manipulate search results.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Their objective is to make AI technologies more trustworthy and transparent...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Able to be relied on as honest or truthful, and easy to perceive or detect; open
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đáng tin cậy và minh bạch

phase3Production.content: For a government to be effective, it must be trustworthy and transparent.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...this new world raises regarding expertise, occupational boundaries and control.’

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The lines or limits that define the scope and responsibilities of a particular job or profession
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ranh giới nghề nghiệp

phase3Production.content: The new technology is blurring the traditional occupational boundaries between designers and engineers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Economist Professor Hamish Low believes that the future of work will involve major transitions across the whole life course for everyone...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Significant or important processes of changing from one state or condition to another
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những chuyển đổi lớn

phase3Production.content: Moving from school to university is one of the major transitions in a young person's life.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘The traditional trajectory of full-time education followed by full-time work followed by a pensioned retirement is a thing of the past,’ says Low.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The usual or conventional path or course of development that something follows
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Quỹ đạo truyền thống

phase3Production.content: Her career followed a traditional trajectory from intern to CEO.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a pensioned retirement is a thing of the past,’ says Low.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Là 'một điều của quá khứ' (a thing of the past) -> đã lỗi thời

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Something that no longer exists or happens
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một điều của quá khứ/lỗi thời

phase3Production.content: With the rise of email, writing letters by hand has become a thing of the past.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Instead, he envisages a multistage employment life: one where retraining happens across the life and where multiple jobs and no job happen by choice at different stages.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Hình dung' (envisages) 'một cuộc đời' (a life) 'làm việc' (employment) 'nhiều giai đoạn' (multistage)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To imagine or expect a working life that consists of several different phases or periods
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hình dung ra một cuộc đời làm việc nhiều giai đoạn

phase3Production.content: The architect envisages a future where cities are greener and more sustainable.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: On the subject of job losses, Low believes the predictions are founded on a fallacy: ‘It assumes that the number of jobs is fixed.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Dựa trên' (founded on) 'một ngụy biện/sai lầm' (a fallacy)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be based on a mistaken belief or a false idea
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dựa trên một ngụy biện

phase3Production.content: His entire argument is founded on a fallacy, so his conclusion is incorrect.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Dr Ewan McGaughey... agrees that ‘apocalyptic’ views about the future of work are misguided.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Opinions or beliefs that describe or prophesy the complete destruction of the world or a system
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những quan điểm tận thế

phase3Production.content: Despite the challenges, he rejected the apocalyptic views about the company's future.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...views about the future of work are misguided.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be based on or showing faulty judgement or reasoning
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Là sai lầm/lạc lối

phase3Production.content: Their belief that the project would be easy was completely misguided.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...not the advent of new technologies that causes unemployment.’

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Sự ra đời/xuất hiện' (advent) 'của' (of) 'các công nghệ mới' (new technologies)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The arrival of a notable new invention or method
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự ra đời của các công nghệ mới

phase3Production.content: The advent of new technologies has transformed the workplace.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: His recently published research answers the question of whether automation, AI and robotics will mean a ‘jobless future’...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A future in which there are no jobs for people, typically because of automation
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một tương lai không có việc làm

phase3Production.content: Many people fear that automation will lead to a jobless future.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘History is clear that change can mean redundancies.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Đồng nghĩa với/có nghĩa là' (mean) 'sự dư thừa lao động' (redundancies)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To result in the state of employees being no longer needed for their jobs and therefore losing them
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đồng nghĩa với sự dư thừa lao động

phase3Production.content: The company's restructuring will unfortunately mean redundancies for about 50 staff.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But social policies can tackle this through retraining and redeployment.’

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Thông qua 'đào tạo lại' (retraining) 'và' (and) 'tái bố trí' (redeployment) (nhân lực)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process of teaching workers new skills and moving them to different jobs
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đào tạo lại và tái bố trí

phase3Production.content: The government has launched a new program for the retraining and redeployment of unemployed workers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘If there is going to be change to jobs as a result of AI and robotics then I’d like to see governments seizing the opportunity to improve policy...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To take hold of an opportunity eagerly and decisively
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nắm bắt cơ hội

phase3Production.content: She is seizing the opportunity to start her own business.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to improve policy to enforce good job security.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make sure that rules protecting workers' jobs are obeyed
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thực thi an ninh việc làm tốt

phase3Production.content: The union's main goal is to enforce good job security for its members.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: McGaughey’s findings are a call to arms to leaders of organisations, governments and banks...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'lời kêu gọi hành động' (a call to arms)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A strong appeal for people to take action on a particular issue
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một lời kêu gọi hành động

phase3Production.content: Her speech was a call to arms for environmental protection.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to pre-empt the coming changes with bold new policies...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Đón đầu/ngăn chặn trước' (pre-empt) 'những thay đổi' (changes) 'sắp tới' (coming)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To take action in order to prevent an anticipated event from happening or to act before it
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đón đầu/ngăn chặn trước những thay đổi sắp tới

phase3Production.content: The company launched a new product to pre-empt the coming changes in the market.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with bold new policies that guarantee full employment, fair incomes and a thriving economic democracy.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Courageous and confident new plans of action
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các chính sách mới táo bạo

phase3Production.content: The government needs to implement bold new policies to tackle climate change.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and a thriving economic democracy.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A flourishing system where economic power is distributed and controlled by the people
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một nền dân chủ kinh tế thịnh vượng

phase3Production.content: Worker cooperatives are seen as a key part of a thriving economic democracy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘The promises of these new technologies are astounding.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Những lời hứa hẹn' (The promises) ... 'thật đáng kinh ngạc' (are astounding)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The potential benefits or positive outcomes are extremely surprising and impressive
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những lời hứa hẹn... thật đáng kinh ngạc

phase3Production.content: The speed of progress in artificial intelligence is astounding.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: They deliver humankind the capacity to live in a way that nobody could have once imagined,’ he adds.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To provide the human race with the ability or power to do something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Mang lại cho loài người năng lực

phase3Production.content: The internet has delivered humankind the capacity to connect instantly across the globe.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘Just as the industrial revolution brought people past subsistence agriculture...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Farming in which the farmers focus on growing enough food to feed themselves and their families
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nông nghiệp tự cung tự cấp

phase3Production.content: Many communities in the developing world still rely on subsistence agriculture.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and the corporate revolution enabled mass production, a third revolution has been pronounced.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The manufacturing of large quantities of standardized products, often using assembly lines
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sản xuất hàng loạt

phase3Production.content: Henry Ford revolutionized the car industry with the introduction of mass production.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: a third revolution has been pronounced
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a third revolution has been pronounced.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'cuộc cách mạng' (revolution) 'thứ ba' (a third) 'đã được' (has been) 'công bố/tuyên bố' (pronounced)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A third major, transformative change has been officially declared or stated
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một cuộc cách mạng thứ ba đã được công bố

phase3Production.content: After the old government fell, a new republic was pronounced.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: the next revolution will be social
lexicalItems.sourceContext: But it will not only be one of technology. The next revolution will be social.’

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Cuộc cách mạng 'tiếp theo' (next) 'sẽ mang tính' (will be) 'xã hội' (social)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The coming major change will relate to society and the way it is organized
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cuộc cách mạng tiếp theo sẽ mang tính xã hội

phase3Production.content: The author argues that after the technological revolution, the next revolution will be social.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...that guarantee full employment, fair incomes and a thriving economic democracy.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Wages or earnings that are reasonable and just for the work done
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thu nhập công bằng

phase3Production.content: The new policy aims to ensure fair incomes for all workers.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...that guarantee full employment, fair incomes and a thriving economic democracy.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The condition in which virtually all who are able and willing to work are employed
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Toàn dụng lao động

phase3Production.content: The government's primary economic goal is to achieve full employment.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...full-time work followed by a pensioned retirement is a thing of the past...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The period of one's life after they have stopped working and receive a regular payment (a pension) from their former employer or the government
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Nghỉ hưu có lương hưu

phase3Production.content: He looked forward to a long and comfortable pensioned retirement.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...one where retraining happens across the life...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process of learning new skills so you can do a different job
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự/việc đào tạo lại

phase3Production.content: The company offered retraining for employees whose jobs were automated.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The algorithm – usually built by external designers – often becomes the keeper of knowledge.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The person or thing that holds and protects important information or expertise
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Người/vật nắm giữ tri thức

phase3Production.content: In ancient times, the village elder was the keeper of knowledge and traditions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a novice stands next to experts and learns by observation.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To acquire knowledge or a skill by watching someone else do it
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Học hỏi bằng cách quan sát

phase3Production.content: Many young animals learn essential survival skills by observation of their parents.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The way telecoms salespeople work is through personal and frequent contact with clients...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Direct and regular communication with someone
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự liên lạc cá nhân và thường xuyên

phase3Production.content: Building a good client relationship requires personal and frequent contact.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...using the benefit of experience to assess a situation and reach a decision.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sử dụng 'lợi ích/lợi thế' (the benefit) 'của' (of) 'kinh nghiệm' (experience)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The advantage gained from knowledge and skills acquired over time
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Lợi ích/lợi thế của kinh nghiệm

phase3Production.content: She had the benefit of experience, having worked in the industry for 20 years.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a short-sighted view begins to creep in...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To begin to happen or affect something, especially in a slow, gradual, and unwelcome way
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Len lỏi vào

phase3Production.content: Despite his confidence, a few doubts began to creep in as the deadline approached.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Alternative explorations – where experimentation and human instinct lead to progress and new ideas – are effectively discouraged.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The investigation of different or unconventional possibilities or methods
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những khám phá thay thế

phase3Production.content: The team was encouraged to engage in alternative explorations to find a creative solution.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...where experimentation and human instinct lead to progress...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nơi 'sự thử nghiệm' (experimentation) và bản năng con người dẫn đến tiến bộ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The process of trying out new ideas, methods, or activities in order to discover what effect they have
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự thử nghiệm

phase3Production.content: Innovation often arises from a process of experimentation and failure.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘It’s the laws that restrict the supply of capital to the job market, not the advent of new technologies that causes unemployment.’

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nguồn cung 'vốn' (capital) cho thị trường việc làm

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Wealth in the form of money or other assets owned by a person or organization, available for a purpose such as starting a company or investing
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Vốn

phase3Production.content: The start-up is trying to raise capital to expand its operations.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to prepare for a fairer future of work and leisure.’

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một tương lai công bằng hơn về công việc và 'sự giải trí/thời gian rảnh rỗi' (leisure)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Time when one is not working or occupied; free time
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thời gian giải trí, rảnh rỗi

phase3Production.content: He spends his leisure time reading and gardening.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ‘Just as the industrial revolution brought people past subsistence agriculture...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The period of major industrialization and innovation that took place during the late 18th and early 19th centuries
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cuộc cách mạng công nghiệp

phase3Production.content: The industrial revolution transformed societies from agrarian to industrial.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and the corporate revolution enabled mass production...

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A significant change in the way businesses and corporations are structured and operate
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cuộc cách mạng doanh nghiệp

phase3Production.content: The rise of multinational companies was a key part of the corporate revolution.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: It’s scenarios like these that many researchers are working to avoid.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'viễn cảnh/kịch bản' (scenarios) như thế này

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A postulated sequence or development of events; a possible future situation
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Các viễn cảnh, kịch bản

phase3Production.content: We need to prepare for all possible scenarios, including the worst-case.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: In the meantime, says Pachidi, ‘We need to make sure we fully understand the dilemmas...’

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Meanwhile; during the time before something else happens
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Trong khi đó

phase3Production.content: The new system will be ready next month. In the meantime, we have to use the old one.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...regarding expertise, occupational boundaries and control.’

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Expert skill or knowledge in a particular field
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chuyên môn, sự tinh thông

phase3Production.content: We need to hire someone with expertise in digital marketing.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and where multiple jobs and no job happen by choice at different stages.

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: As a result of one's own decision and free will, not because one is forced
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Do lựa chọn, tự nguyện

phase3Production.content: She is not unemployed; she is taking a year off by choice to travel the world.
